title: Calories in Eggs Benedict
meta_description: Discover calories in eggs benedict for a standard serving, including macros like protein and fat, plus tweaks and FAQs for variations.
assumptions: Standard serving: 1 English muffin, 2 poached eggs, 2 slices Canadian bacon, 3 tbsp hollandaise sauce; no extras like potatoes.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, portion size, brand, and preparation method. Check restaurant info or labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One serving of eggs benedict has about 825 kcal, with high fat from the hollandaise.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged or restaurant data.

tweaks.label: Add smoked salmon instead of bacon
Whole grain muffin and egg whites only

faqs.q: How many calories in one serving of eggs benedict?
faqs.a: Approximately 825 kcal for a standard serving with hollandaise.

faqs.q: What makes eggs benedict high in calories?
faqs.a: The hollandaise sauce contributes the most fat and calories, around 300-400 kcal.

faqs.q: How much protein is in eggs benedict?
faqs.a: About 32 g protein per serving, mainly from eggs and bacon.

faqs.q: Can I make eggs benedict lower calorie?
faqs.a: Yes, use less hollandaise, turkey bacon, or a lighter sauce to cut 100-200 kcal.

faqs.q: What's the sodium in eggs benedict?
faqs.a: Around 1450 mg per serving, from bacon and sauce; watch if on a low-sodium diet.
